p: Compared to adults, pregnant women and children below five years of age are more affected [ 6– 9]. The disease not only causes mortality and morbidity but also poses socioeconomic crisis [ 1, 2, 4]. Expenses for hospitals, absence from schools, reduced work force, influences on tourism, and reduced attraction for investors are among the economic burdens from the disease. During the last decade alone, international partners and the malaria endemic country governments spent more than nineteen billion United States dollars in order to combat malaria [ 2– 4].
